item.title: Modify Machine Code in Executables
item.description:
Modifying Machine Code in Executables Link to heading

In this post, weâ€™ll walk through a simple but fun reverse-engineering exercise: taking a compiled C program, locating the machine instructions responsible for printing characters, and modifying those bytes directly in the executable.

This is a great way to build intuition around how compilers translate code, how functions map to assembly, and how tools like objdump and xxd help us inspect and patch binaries.
